text:
In India, every half an
hour, one smallholder farmer
does suicide.

To understand the hopelessness,
let's suppose you all
are smallholder farmers.

You had a great harvest,
will you be happy?
No.

Most of you grew the same
crop, creating an excess supply
situation.

So the price crashes
to its lowest

when your need for the
money is at its highest.

There is no option other
than to sell your harvest
at a throwaway price.

Growing up in a
smallholder household,

I lived through this
hopelessness every day.

Gramhal solves this issue by
helping smallholder farmers

to store their harvest
at a warehouse, access

credit against it, and
sell their harvest when
the prices are good.

Our platform turns grains
into digital currency

and builds the agency
of smallholder farmers

to decide and to
sell, whom to sell to,
and at an affordable price.

We hope you will
join us in our vision

to make a world that
where no farmer has
to try to feed the planet.
Thank you.
